# Chord: Minor 7th in G (Shape: G)

## Brief Description
The Minor 7th chord in G (Shape: G) is a four-note chord built on the root note G, featuring the notes G, B, D, and F. It adds a jazzy, melancholic sound to your chord progressions and is widely used in various genres due to its versatility and emotional resonance.

## Notes and Intervals
- G (Root)
- B (Minor 3rd)
- D (Perfect 5th)
- F (Minor 7th)

## Musical Flavor
The Minor 7th in G chord has a mellow and moody character, often conveying a sense of introspection, tension, or a touch of sophistication to a musical piece. It can evoke feelings of longing, introspection, or mystery, adding depth and complexity to a song.

## Genre and Usage
This chord is commonly used in jazz, blues, R&B, soul, funk, and various other contemporary genres. It is a staple in jazz harmony and is often employed in ballads, soulful compositions, and songs that require a touch of emotional depth and complexity.

2. **"Don't Know Why" by Norah Jones**
3. **"Summertime" by George Gershwin**
